channel.title: 6 Minute Vocabulary on SWIEST - Transcripts · Screenplays · Lyrics
channel.description: Recent content in 6 Minute Vocabulary on SWIEST - Transcripts · Screenplays · Lyrics

item.title: Suffixes: -ness & -ity | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to Neil and Catherine talk about words with the suffixes -ness and -ity. Transcript

item.title: Discourse markers: showing attitude | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description fortunately, obviously, seriously, ideally. Transcript

item.title: Suffixes: -ment, -ance, -ence | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description ExciteMENT, performANCE, differENCE - how suffixes turn verbs and adjectives into nouns. Transcript

item.title: Someone, somewhere, anywhere... | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Learn how to use these very useful pronouns with 'some' and 'any'. Transcript

item.title: Irregular verbs | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Choose, chose, chosen... We talk about verbs that don't follow the -ed pattern. Transcript

item.title: Reporting verbs | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Learn about verbs that we use when we talk about what someone else has said. Transcript

item.title: False friends | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Embarrassed - or pregnant? Words you think you know but mean something else in English. Transcript

item.title: Words with 'ough' | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Cough, thought, enough, although: Learn how to pronounce words with 'ough'. Transcript

item.title: Easily confused words | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Boring or bored? Learn about words that look similar but have very different meaning. Transcript

item.title: Suffixes: -less and -free | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Is this a smoke-free or a smokeless workplace? Learn the difference! Transcript

item.title: Prefixes de, dis, dys | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Do you suffer from dyspepsia? Could a detox diet help? Learn about prefixes. Transcript

item.title: Ordinal numbers | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description What's the date today? And do you know how to say it? Transcript

item.title: Short spoken forms | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Gonna, wanna, dunno, whatcha… are these really English words? Who uses them and why? Transcript

item.title: Uncountable nouns | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description What is more important in life: knowledge, money or happiness? Transcript

item.title: Time expression with in, on and at | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Learn how to use time expression with the preposition in, on and at Transcript

item.title: Hyphenation | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Find out why we write some phrases with hyphens but not others. Transcript

item.title: Words with double letters | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Catherine and Finn talk about spelling words with double letters in 6 Minute Vocabulary. Transcript

item.title: Pronouncing verbs and nouns | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Learn how to pronounce verbs and nouns with Neil and Catherine. Transcript

item.title: British and American English | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Catherine and Doug discuss British and American English Transcript

item.title: Business jargon | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Can you think out of the box or take the helicopter view at work? Learn business jargon. Transcript

item.title: How to pronounce words that start with 'c'. | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description 'c' or 's'? Learn how to spell words that begin with a /s/ sound. Transcript

item.title: Phrasal verbs and context | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description When talking about moving in, moving out and moving on, what do we mean? We explain. Transcript

item.title: re, pre and pro | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Do you recycle your rubbish? Do you buy prepacked food? Are you proactive? Transcript

item.title: Silent letters | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description How do you pronounce the words night and knight? Transcript

item.title: Onomatopoeia | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Learn about words that sound like the thing they describe. Transcript

item.title: Multi-word verbs | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Do you ever 'meet up with' your friend in the park? We talk about multi-word verbs. Transcript

item.title: Adjectives ending with -ic and -ical | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description We explain how some adjectives end in either -ic or -ical, depending on their meaning. Transcript

item.title: Strong adjectives | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to our fantastic, wonderful programme about strong adjectives. Transcript

item.title: Male and female job words | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description How words change depending on whether a man or a woman is doing the job. Transcript

item.title: New words | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Rob and Catherine are here to help you update your language! Transcript

item.title: Weather words | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description British people love to talk about weather! Learn some useful vocabulary about it here. Transcript

item.title: Homophones | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Learn about words that sound the same but have different meanings Transcript

item.title: Compound nouns | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Ice cream, popcorn... Learn about nouns made up of a combination of two words. Transcript

item.title: Adjective order | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description We explain the order you put adjectives in when describing a dog! Transcript

item.title: Contractions | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Finn and Feifei help you learn this important part of speaking and writing, in English. Transcript

item.title: Job suffixes | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description What's the connection between a teacher, a driver or a presenter? Transcript

item.title: Word stress | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Do you know how to pronounce the words photographer and photograph? We can help you. Transcript

item.title: Compound adjectives | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Learn how to use compound adjectives (e.g. low-fat yoghurt, high-quality carbohydrates). Transcript

item.title: Lexical sets | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Finn and Catherine give you some tips on how to remember new words. Transcript

item.title: -ing and -ed adjectives | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Interested or interesting? Which adjective do you use? We discuss -ing and -ed adjectives Transcript

item.title: Binomials: phrases made of two words | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Do you want some cheap and cheerful tips to improve your English? Listen to learn more. Transcript

item.title: Useful chunks of language | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Do you like to eat a full English breakfast? Listen to find out how to use this phrase. Transcript

item.title: Prefixes: un-, in- and dis- | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Learn some prefixes which we hope won't make you feel unhappy. Transcript

item.title: Adjectives and adverbs | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Fashionable? Fashionably? We teach you adjectives and adverbs. Transcript

item.title: Suffixes | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Finn and Alice look at a very important part of word building – suffixes. Transcript

item.title: Academic Vocabulary | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Do you have to write academic texts and essays? We give you some tips on how to do it. Transcript

item.title: Talk like Shakespeare | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Learn some idioms from 'the Bard' which are in common use today. Transcript

item.title: More irregular verbs | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Write, wrote, written. Speak, spoke, spoken - learn more about irregular verbs. Transcript

item.title: Eponyms as nouns and verbs | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description To google, to hoover... Learn about words that have come from commercial products. Transcript

item.title: Adjectives from names | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description We discuss a group of adjectives that are made from the names of famous people. Transcript

item.title: Large numbers | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description How many stars are there in the universe? Learn how to say big numbers in English. Transcript

item.title: Suffixes: -tian, -sion and -tion | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Have we got your attention? Listen and learn how to use suffixes -tian, -sion and -tion. Transcript

item.title: Synonyms | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Learn about synonyms - words that have the same or similar meaning. Transcript

item.title: Discourse Markers: Interjections | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Do you know your ouch! from your ugh!? These words are called interjections. Transcript

item.title: Commonly misspelled words | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Weird or weird? English spelling is fascinating – but it's not always straightforward! Transcript

item.title: Linking words | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to Angela talk about her lucky shark escape and learn some linking words. Transcript

item.title: Words with more than one spelling | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Disk or disc? Confused about which one to use? Finn and Catherine talk about spelling. Transcript

item.title: Acronyms | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description Listen to Peter and Catherine talking about acronyms like NASA and FIFA in this podcast. Transcript

item.title: Antonyms | 6 Minute Vocabulary
item.description: Podcast Description A good way of building vocabulary in English is to learn words with opposite meanings. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description ‘Happiness’ and 'responsibility'. Learn words with the suffixes -ness and -ity. Transcript

item.description: Podcast Description Fortunately, obviously, seriously, ideally. These words are useful. How do we use them? Transcript
